articles.title: Is Ilia Topuria REALLY the Scariest Guy in the UFC?
articles.description: Justin Gaethje said something you almost never hear from a guy like that: he loves the idea of how scared he‚Äôd be if he drew Ilia Topuria. And the shocking part isn‚Äôt fear ‚Äî it‚Äôs that Gaetjje said it out loud. In this video, I‚Äôm asking the real question behind that quote: have we actually seen enough from Ilia Topuria to treat him like the company‚Äôs boogeyman? Yes, he‚Äôs dangerous. Yes, he has power. We all saw the clean finishing ability ‚Äî including the knockout of Alexander Volkanovski and the first-round stoppage of Charles Oliveira. But does that automatically make him scarier than everyone else, even guys who‚Äôve been through the Islam Makhachev and Khabib Nurmagomedov era? Greatness isn‚Äôt just highlights. The all-time greats prove they can deal with adversity ‚Äî bad rounds, fatigue, injuries, momentum swings ‚Äî and still find a way. Jon Jones has shown that for years. With Topuria, the question is simple: is he so dominant he‚Äôll never face adversity‚Ä¶ or have we just not seen it yet? Drop a comment and tell me straight: is Ilia Topuria already one of the scariest men in MMA ‚Äî or are we getting ahead of ourselves? Watch more for UFC breakdowns, matchmaking logic, and the real story behind the quotes. #UFC #IliaTopuria #JustinGaethje #MMA #UFCLightweight #UFCNews #Volkanovski #CharlesOliveira #CombatSportsBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: This Idea Completely Devalues the BMF Belt
articles.description: There‚Äôs a suggestion floating around that sounds clever on paper ‚Äî but completely falls apart once you think it through. The idea is simple: the winner of Max Holloway vs Charles Oliveira becomes the number one contender and fights the winner of Paddy Pimblett vs Justin Gaethje. On the surface, it sounds fun. In reality, it creates a serious problem. That suggestion reportedly came from Paddy himself ‚Äî and while fans may brush that off, champions calling shots matters. Historically, when a champion points at an opponent, the UFC often listens. But tying that path to the BMF belt is where this idea goes wrong. The BMF belt has always been different. It‚Äôs rare. It‚Äôs ceremonial. It‚Äôs treated as something special ‚Äî from Madison Square Garden to sold-out arenas and historic nights. Turning it into a number-one-contender shortcut strips it of what makes it meaningful. This video explains why the BMF belt shouldn‚Äôt be used to ‚Äúget something else,‚Äù why unifying logic matters, and how fighters like Arman Tsarukyan aren‚Äôt being punished ‚Äî they‚Äôre simply caught in a calendar jam created by moving parts and timing. Watch the full breakdown and decide for yourself whether this plan elevates the division ‚Äî or quietly damages one of the UFC‚Äôs most unique titles. Subscribe for more real talk on UFC matchmaking, belts, and championship logic. #UFC #BMF #MaxHolloway #CharlesOliveira #JustinGaethje #PaddyPimblett #MMAAnalysisBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: The Interim Belt Problem Nobody Wants to Admit
articles.description: There‚Äôs a quiet problem developing in the UFC heavyweight division ‚Äî and almost nobody is talking about it. A casual conversation between Paddy Pimblett and Tom Aspinall may have accidentally exposed it. Aspinall openly discussed ongoing issues with his eye, following advice from Michael Bisping, who knows firsthand what happens when fighters rush back from serious eye injuries. That alone changes the conversation ‚Äî because if Tom can‚Äôt return yet, the UFC faces real pressure to introduce an interim heavyweight title. But here‚Äôs where it gets complicated. If there‚Äôs an interim belt, Ciryl Gane is impossible to exclude. He‚Äôs already been promised a title fight. And if Gane is involved, that creates a major problem for Jon Jones, who ‚Äî despite being under contract ‚Äî has quietly disappeared from the UFC rankings altogether. That absence matters. Rankings determine eligibility, legitimacy, and ultimately who gets the biggest fights. And if Jones isn‚Äôt ranked, headlining a massive event with a title attached becomes nearly impossible. This video breaks down why an interim heavyweight title sounds simple ‚Äî but may actually be the one move that collapses every option the UFC has left. Watch, decide for yourself, and tell me: if there‚Äôs an interim belt‚Ä¶ who fights for it? üëâ Subscribe for more behind-the-scenes breakdowns of UFC politics, matchmaking, and championship logic. #UFC #JonJones #TomAspinall #CirylGane #Heavyweight #UFCTitle #MMAAnalysisBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Ben Askren & Daniel Cormier on Ben's double lung transplant recovery, DC vs. Jon Jones match, Khabib
articles.description: In a much anticipated episode, Ben Askren IS OFFICIALLY BACK on the Daniel Cormier Show with DC in a brand new edition of Funky & The Champ! Askren talks about his long road to recovery since his double lung transplant. Ben also talks to DC about the days leading up to being in the hospital and what that journey has been like for him as well as his friends and family. After, the guys talk Real American Freestyle (RAF), and Cormier says he'd wrestle Jon Jones and BEAT HIM. Plus, the guys talk about Khabib Nurmagomedov's viral comments about the UFC and promoting superstars, Justin Gaethje "wanting to be scared" to fight Ilia Topuria, and Ben's role with the RAF wrestling competitions! All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms! articles.title: Why Conor McGregor Is Still #1 in 2026
articles.description: Everyone knew who number one was going to be. In this episode, Chael Sonnen breaks down why Conor McGregor remains the most compelling figure in MMA heading into 2026 ‚Äî despite not having fought in years. This isn‚Äôt about belts. It‚Äôs not about rankings. And it‚Äôs not about technique. Chael explains that no matter how good Conor is at a specific skill, there‚Äôs always another fighter who can match it. What can‚Äôt be matched is the one thing no other fighter has: the mandate of the masses. If Conor wants a fight in February, it happens. If he wants a new weight class in March, it exists. No other fighter ‚Äî not champions, not contenders ‚Äî has that kind of pull. From media demand to promotional leverage, Chael lays out why Conor can still command attention from outlets, promoters, and fans in a way no one else can. He also addresses the uncertainty around Conor‚Äôs future ‚Äî boxing, MMA, or retirement ‚Äî and why the real answer may already be written. Chael reflects on Conor‚Äôs withdrawal from the Michael Chandler fight, his relationship with Dana White, and why talk of title fights or matchups with Islam Makhachev may be more fantasy than reality. Love him or hate him, one thing is undeniable: Conor McGregor is still the biggest draw in MMA ‚Äî and still the number one fighter to watch in 2026. Watch more from Chael Sonnen for unfiltered MMA insight. #ConorMcGregor #ChaelSonnen #UFC #MMA2026 #FightBusiness #MMANews #CombatSportsBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: 'Tom Aspinall MIGHT NEVER FIGHT AGAIN?!' | BISPING REACTS
articles.description: Thank you to today‚Äôs video sponsor, Solaray Vitamins. Their all-new men‚Äôs line is designed to help you fuel your edge, because you‚Äôre built for more. Stock up today and get 30% off by heading to https://solaray.yt.link/obS1sGR and using BISPING. *These statements have not be evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. DISCOUNT CODE: BISPING ----- Will Tom Aspinall ever fight again? After suffering a serious eye injury at UFC 321 and potentially requiring surgery, the UFC heavyweight division is once again in chaos. In this video, I break down what actually happened to Aspinall‚Äôs eye, why eye surgery is never something you can rush, and how criticism of him quitting is completely misplaced. I also react to Joe Rogan‚Äôs comments, share my own experience fighting with eye damage, and explain why the UFC may be forced to introduce an interim heavyweight title fight if Aspinall is sidelined for months. With Jon Jones walking away and uncertainty around the champion‚Äôs return, I discuss why **Alex Pereira vs Ciryl Gane could make sense ‚Äî and what it all means for the future of the heavyweight division. #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #tomaspinall #cirylgane

articles.title: Justin Gaethje: Champion or Retired by 2026
articles.description: What if there‚Äôs no middle ground? In this episode, Chael Sonnen opens his 2026 Fighters to Watch countdown with a hard truth about Justin Gaethje: by this time next year, he‚Äôll either be a world champion ‚Äî or he‚Äôll be gone. Not fading. Not hanging on. Gone. Chael reflects on the moment every fighter eventually faces ‚Äî the realization that the sport doesn‚Äôt last forever, and that one day it ends whether you‚Äôre ready or not. From there, he explains why Gaethje stands apart from so many others at lightweight. This isn‚Äôt about money. It isn‚Äôt about fame. And it isn‚Äôt about not knowing how to leave. Justin Gaethje knows exactly what he wants. With an interim title opportunity at 155 pounds looming, Chael questions the very idea of ‚Äúinterim champions,‚Äù calling it a title of grace ‚Äî and explains why, if Gaethje wins, that belt must become undisputed. If a champion can‚Äôt or won‚Äôt fight, the belt belongs to the man who will. Chael also breaks down why Gaethje‚Äôs mindset matters: when he says ‚Äúgive me a title fight or send me home,‚Äù he means it ‚Äî and he‚Äôs willing to step aside cleanly if it doesn‚Äôt happen. The looming question: is that enough to beat Paddy Pimblett? That breakdown comes later. For now, this is about stakes, honesty, and a fighter who refuses to linger. Number five on the list: Justin Gaethje. #JustinGaethje #ChaelSonnen #UFC #MMA2026 #LightweightDivision #FightAnalysis #FightersToWatchBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Why Diego Lopez vs Jean Silva Stole 2025
articles.description: Chael Sonnen reacts to what he believes could be the greatest fight of 2025, breaking down Diego Lopez vs Jean Silva. Despite coming off a loss, Diego Lopez stepped into a high-stakes matchup against a surging Jean Silva, sharing the spotlight with Crawford vs Canelo ‚Äî and delivered chaos. Both fighters flipped the switch, pressed forward, and refused to back down in a brutal, aggressive brawl that instantly entered Fight of the Year discussions. This is what happens when opportunity meets violence.

articles.title: Is Ian Garry the One to Dethrone Islam Makhachev? #ufc
articles.description: Chael Sonnen puts the spotlight on one of the most uncomfortable questions in MMA right now: Can Ian Garry actually beat Islam Makhachev? It‚Äôs easy to dismiss the idea ‚Äî until Chael asks how it could happen. Is Garry skilled enough? Is the matchup wrong for Islam? Or are we seeing the early signs of a real contender who can revive the chaos that once surrounded Conor vs Khabib? Chael challenges fans to be honest with themselves. If you believe Ian Garry can be a world champion, this is the fight that proves it.

articles.title: Chael Sonnen: All Options Are on the Table for Jake
articles.description: Number four on the 2026 ‚Äúfighters to watch‚Äù list isn‚Äôt a conventional pick ‚Äî and that‚Äôs exactly why it works. In this episode, Chael Sonnen explains why Jake Paul belongs in the conversation heading into 2026: because every door is open. Boxing is the obvious lane, but Chael argues the bigger story is Jake‚Äôs obsession with competition ‚Äî and the idea that MMA has always been sitting in the background. Chael revisits early footage and rumors that shaped the ‚ÄúPaul brothers can fight‚Äù narrative, then zooms out to what actually drives Jake: grit, self-belief, toughness, and the willingness to do the hard work that most people never fully give credit for. This isn‚Äôt about a clean jab or perfect fundamentals ‚Äî it‚Äôs about proving he belongs in the arena at all. From the early ‚Äúcelebrity boxing‚Äù perception to the moment Jake started chasing legitimacy ‚Äî rankings, world titles, and the biggest names possible ‚Äî Chael breaks down how the experiment changed, and why the crowd still refuses to admit what‚Äôs right in front of them. And here‚Äôs the key: Chael believes everything is still on the table for Jake Paul in 2026‚Ä¶ including retirement. That uncertainty is the story. #JakePaul #ChaelSonnen #Boxing #MMA #UFC #CombatSports #2026Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Francis Ngannou Is the Biggest Wildcard of 2026
articles.description: Number three on the 2026 fighters-to-watch list is the most complicated name of them all. In this episode, Chael Sonnen explains why Francis Ngannou remains one of the most fascinating figures in combat sports ‚Äî even though no one, including Francis himself, seems certain about what comes next. Chael pulls back the curtain on what fighters don‚Äôt realize until it‚Äôs gone: how rare the opportunity to compete truly is. Opponents, promoters, licensing, medicals, venues ‚Äî everything has to align just to make a fight possible. And once those pieces stop lining up, careers don‚Äôt fade‚Ä¶ they end. That‚Äôs the crossroads Francis now stands at. Chael breaks down the reality of boxing options at this stage of Ngannou‚Äôs career, why big-name boxers and promoters may hesitate, and why passing on a massive payday against Jake Paul revealed something important about Francis‚Äô mindset. This isn‚Äôt about easy money ‚Äî it‚Äôs about meaning. So where does MMA fit? Chael explores the Professional Fighters League as the most realistic path forward, and dives into potential matchups with Vadim Nemkov or the truly mythical option: Gable Steveson. That leads to the central question of the episode: if you can book any fight, why settle for one that doesn‚Äôt matter most? Francis Ngannou still has power. He still has leverage. What remains uncertain is whether the right opportunity ‚Äî and the right willingness ‚Äî will present itself in 2026. For that reason alone, Francis Ngannou lands at number three. #FrancisNgannou #ChaelSonnen #MMA #PFL #CombatSports #2026 #FightersToWatchBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Alex Pereira Could End the GOAT Debate in 2026
articles.description: Number two on the 2026 fighters-to-watch list isn‚Äôt just about winning fights ‚Äî it‚Äôs about ending arguments. In this episode, Chael Sonnen explains why Alex Pereira is one victory away from doing something no fighter has ever done: ending the GOAT conversation entirely. The ‚Äúgreatest of all time‚Äù debate has always been about eras, nostalgia, and fan loyalty. It‚Äôs not a tournament ‚Äî it‚Äôs a barroom argument. But Chael lays out the case that a heavyweight championship run in 2026 would eliminate the debate altogether. If Pereira becomes heavyweight champion after already holding world titles at middleweight and light heavyweight, the discussion stops. There‚Äôs nothing left to argue. Chael revisits a heated ESPN year-in-review debate with Daniel Cormier and Jon Anik, where he argued Pereira should have been Fighter of the Year simply for holding belts in two divisions within a single calendar year. The argument didn‚Äôt win then ‚Äî but history may prove it right. Now the path is clear, but brutal. To reach heavyweight gold, Pereira would likely have to go through Tom Aspinall, Jon Jones, or Ciryl Gane. Every option is dangerous. Every option is possible. What makes this compelling is motivation. Pereira already holds gold. He doesn‚Äôt need to do this. But as Chael explains, once a fighter reaches that level, the only thing left is legacy. If Alex Pereira becomes heavyweight champion in 2026 ‚Äî interim or undisputed ‚Äî it won‚Äôt just be the biggest story of the year. It may be the final word in MMA greatness. That‚Äôs why he comes in at number two. #AlexPereira #ChaelSonnen #UFC #MMA2026 #GOATDebate #Heavyweight #CombatSportsBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: UFC Heavyweight Division Is Broken‚Äîand Here‚Äôs Why
articles.description: What‚Äôs right in MMA isn‚Äôt always what‚Äôs popular‚Äîand nowhere is that more obvious than the heavyweight division. In this clip, Chael Sonnen breaks down why heavyweight is so difficult to predict, promote, and stabilize. From the lack of elite wrestling pedigrees to the absence of clear storytelling, this division doesn‚Äôt function like the others‚Äîand pretending it does only creates confusion. Chael reacts to conversations around the division involving Jon Jones, Tom Aspinall, and Ciryl Gane, explaining why ‚Äúbig fights‚Äù aren‚Äôt just opinions‚Äîthey‚Äôre tools. Tools that generate attention, headlines, and engagement‚Ä¶ if the story is there. That leads to the biggest question of all: where does Alex Pereira fit into this mess? Does he defend his belt? Does he move up? Does he fight Jon Jones? And if he does‚Äîwhat are they even fighting for? Chael explores interim titles, stripped belts, injured champions, and why Carlos Ulberg may be getting caught in the middle of a situation he didn‚Äôt create. The takeaway is simple but uncomfortable: prestige and money aren‚Äôt enough. If fans don‚Äôt care before the fight, the fight doesn‚Äôt matter. This is heavyweight MMA stripped of fantasy booking‚Äîwhat works, what doesn‚Äôt, and why the next decision matters more than all the arguments combined. Watch more Chael Sonnen for real fight analysis, promotion logic, and MMA truth-telling. #UFC #Heavyweight #JonJones #AlexPereira #TomAspinall #CirylGane #MMATalk #ChaelSonnenBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Ian Garry Says Beating Islam Makes Him Pound-for-Pound #1
articles.description: Ian Garry just said the quiet part out loud. Reading his words verbatim, Garry laid out a vision that goes far beyond winning a world title. He claims that when he beats Islam Makhachev, there will be no excuses‚Äîand that victory will make him the greatest pound-for-pound fighter in the world. That‚Äôs a massive statement. And it raises an even bigger question: How do you become pound-for-pound number one by beating Islam? In this clip, Chael Sonnen breaks down what Garry is really saying, what he might actually be aiming for, and why this isn‚Äôt about belts, main events, or even championships. This is about legacy‚Äîand about skipping steps that most fighters never even dream of skipping. Chael explores whether Garry is getting ahead of himself, or whether this is the move of a smart storyteller who understands how to place himself in history. From the shadow of Khabib Nurmagomedov to the realities of pound-for-pound rankings, this conversation goes far beyond a single fight. One thing is clear: Ian Garry didn‚Äôt say he hopes to be pound-for-pound number one. He said it like a man who believes it‚Äôs inevitable. And sometimes, that‚Äôs step one. Watch more from Chael Sonnen for unfiltered MMA analysis, rankings debates, and fight philosophy. #IanGarry #IslamMakhachev #UFC #PoundForPound #MMATalk #ChaelSonnen #UFCRankingsBad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench
